var_notes: Number of bedrooms in the property, defined based on building square footage and the judgement of the person in the field.
Black population percentage of the census tract containing the property centroid.
As measured from the exterior of the building.

Dozens of codes attached to face sheet that denote a number of seemingly unrelated characteristics associated with a PIN, ranging from condition to types of subsidies. This field does not match across the SQL server/AS-400.
Last 6 digits of GEOID for matched census tract (tract ID only).
Longitude coordinate of the property's location, as defined by the centroid of the parcel shape in GIS.
Latitude coordinate of the property's location, as defined by the centroid of the parcel shape in GIS.
In general, this field is not used consistently and is therefore not useful for analytical purposes
In general, this field is not used consistently and is therefore not useful for analytical purposes
In general, this field is not used consistently and is therefore not useful for analytical purposes
Number of full bathrooms, defined as having a bath or shower. If this value is missing, the default value is set to 1.
Number of fireplaces, counted as the number of flues one can see from the outside of the building.
Is Garage 1 physically including within the building area? If yes, the garage area is subtracted from the building square feet calculation by the field agent.
Is Garage 1 physically including within the building area? If yes, the garage area is subtracted from the building square feet calculation by the field agent.
Is Garage 2 physically including within the building area? If yes, the garage area is subtracted from the building square feet calculation by the field agent.
Is Garage 2 physically including within the building area? If yes, the garage area is subtracted from the building square feet calculation by the field agent.
Full 11-digit GEOID for matched census tract.
Number of half baths, defined as bathrooms without a shower or bathtub.
Square feet of the land (not just the building) of the property. Note that land is divided into 'plots' and 'parcels' - this field applies to parcels, identified by PIN.
Hispanic population percentage of the census tract containing the property centroid.
Need to clarify definition.
Need to clarify definition.
Median income of the census tract containing the property centroid.

Field that serves as a key when multiple buildings or improvements exist on the same PIN. Numeric values do not necessary correspond to number of buildings, they can also represent improvements added through Home Improvement Exemptions (288s).

Field that serves as a key when multiple buildings or improvements exist on the same PIN. Numeric values do not necessary correspond to number of buildings, they can also represent improvements added through Home Improvement Exemptions (288s).

Modeling group, as defined by the property class. Properties with class 200, 201, 241, 299 is defined as "NCHARS", short for "no characteristics", which are condos and vacant land classes. Properties with class 202, 203, 204, 205, 206, 207, 208, 209, 210, 235, 278, and 295 are "SF", short for "single-family." Properties with class 211 and 212 are "MF", short for "multi-family."

Field that serves as a key when multiple buildings or improvements exist on the same PIN. Numeric values do not necessary correspond to number of buildings, they can also represent improvements added through Home Improvement Exemptions (288s).
Indicates a property with multiple improvements on one PIN, e.g. a main house and a coach house. NOT to be confused with a property which was part of a multi-pin sale.
Number of commercial units (the vast majority are for properties with class 212).
Other population percentage of the census tract containing the property centroid.
Percent of ownership of a condo building for a unit as defined by the condominium declaration. If missing, default is 1/n_units.
Percent of ownership of a condo building for a unit as defined by the condominium declaration. If missing, default is 1/n_units.
All PINs are 14 digits: 2 digits for area + 2 digits for sub area + 2 digits for block + 2 digits for parcel + 4 digits for the multicode
Board of Review final estimated market value of building from the prior tax year.
Board of Review final estimated market value of land from the prior tax year.

Number of rooms in the property (excluding baths). Not to be confused with bedrooms

Tax amount paid by the property owner. Taken from Cook County Treasurer's Office.
Tax rate paid by the property owner. Taken from Cook County Treasurer's Office.
This field name comes from a variable that is no longer used, but the field name was not changed to reflect Cathedral Ceiling
This field name comes from a variable that is no longer used, but the field name was not changed to reflect Cathedral Ceiling

Residences with 1.5 - 1.9 stories are one story and have partial livable attics and are classified based on the square footage of the attic compared to the first floor of the house. So, 1.5 story houses have an attic that is 50% of the area of the first floor, 1.6 story houses are 60%, 1.7 are 70%, etc. However, what is recorded on the field card differs from what is in the database. All 1.5 - 1.9 story houses are coded as 5

White population percentage of the census tract containing the property centroid.
Indicates whether the property is within 100 feet of a major road.
Indicates whether the property is between 101 and 300 feet of a major road.
If true, property class is either 208 or 209.
If true, the recorded characteristics do not align with the recorded class. See chars_check_class() function in CCAO package for details.
Large lot factor variable, where 1 acre of land (land square feet > 43559) is defined as a large lot. 1 = large lot, 0 = not a large lot.
Indicates presence of a garage of any size.
Indicates whether a sale has pure market/arms length characteristics.

var_name_pretty: Number of Foreclosures in Town Per Month
var_notes: The number of foreclosures in the property's township during the month the sale occurred in

var_name_pretty: Number of Foreclosures in Town Per Quarter
var_notes: The number of foreclosures in the property's township during the quarter the sale occurred in
Sale year calculated as the number of years since 1997.
Sale month calculated as the number of months since January 1997.
Numeric encoding of month of year (1-12).
Numeric encoding of quarter of year (1-4).
